questions.explanation:
7. When will the office be open after the renovations?
(A) Tuesday morning. → Correct (specifies the reopening time)
(B) Some inventory control. → Incorrect (unrelated to office opening)
(C) I'll wear a business suit. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

8. Why didn't we order more watches for the store?
(A) Because we haven't sold many lately. → Correct (explains the reason for not ordering)
(B) I can watch that for you. → Incorrect (misinterprets 'watch' and is irrelevant)
(C) In alphabetical order, please. → Incorrect (unrelated to the question)

9. Which workshop do you want to attend?
(A) I'd prefer the one on leadership skills. → Correct (specifies the preferred workshop)
(B) His office is upstairs. → Incorrect (refers to location, not workshop)
(C) Sure, that works for me. → Incorrect (vague and does not specify a workshop)

10. Who else needs to approve the logo design?
(A) Every page is numbered. → Incorrect (unrelated to logo approval)
(B) Yes, let me get you a pen instead. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I'm waiting for a call from our marketing department. → Correct (implies marketing department's approval is needed)

11. Can you please turn up the lights so I can take a photograph?
(A) This isn't very heavy. → Incorrect (unrelated to lighting request)
(B) Sure, no problem. → Correct (agrees to adjust the lights)
(C) The music is quite loud. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

12. Where can I get my passport renewed?
(A) Two hours long. → Incorrect (refers to time, not location)
(B) There's a list of locations online. → Correct (provides a source for renewal locations)
(C) Yes, I travel frequently. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

13. How are we going to increase our sales?
(A) He works in the accounting office. → Incorrect (unrelated to sales strategy)
(B) Yes, I am going there. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) By advertising on social media. → Correct (proposes a sales strategy)

14. Why did you replace the coffee machine in the break room?
(A) She installed new software. → Incorrect (unrelated to coffee machine)
(B) A company credit card. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the reason)
(C) There was a sale. → Correct (explain why replacement was needed)

15. Where is Mr. Kim meeting with the new interns?
(A) I've conducted several workshops. → Incorrect (unrelated to meeting location)
(B) We met when we were in college. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Didn't you get the memo? → Correct (implies the location was shared in a memo)

16. When will the client sign the contract?
(A) No, my desk is made from solid wood. → Incorrect (unrelated to contract signing)
(B) We're scheduled to do that this afternoon. → Correct (specifies the signing time)
(C) Fourteen new employees is a record! → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

17. Can I order some dessert?
(A) The kitchen closed an hour ago. → Correct (explains why dessert cannot be ordered)
(B) To start the meal. → Incorrect (unrelated to dessert order)
(C) She usually walks there. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

18. Isn't Mr. Romero managing the storeroom inventory?
(A) No, he's working with a different team. → Correct (corrects the assumption about Mr. Romero)
(B) The warehouse on Mill Street. → Incorrect (refers to location, not management)
(C) OK, I'll be there soon. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

19. Will the new software be installed tonight or tomorrow?
(A) Your computer is already fully updated. → Correct (implies the software is already installed)
(B) The password is confidential. → Incorrect (unrelated to installation timing)
(C) About twenty minutes. → Incorrect (refers to time duration, not schedule)

20. When do you need me to return the projector?
(A) At the company headquarters. → Incorrect (refers to location, not time)
(B) Turn right at the light. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) By the end of the week. → Correct (specifies the return deadline)

21. I don't think we'll need the large conference room.
(A) Only ten people registered. → Correct (supports the smaller room choice)
(B) We'll take the large shirts, please. → Incorrect (unrelated to conference room)
(C) I'm going to Milan this year. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

22. There's going to be a coffee break, isn't there?
(A) No, the plastic cups won't break. → Incorrect (misinterprets 'break' and is irrelevant)
(B) I'll just look in the directory. Thanks. → Incorrect (unrelated to coffee break)
(C) It is a six-hour conference. → Correct (confirm not have the break)

23. Has next quarter's budget been approved?
(A) I saw that film last week. → Incorrect (unrelated to budget approval)
(B) Three kilometers away. → Incorrect (refers to distance, not approval)
(C) It's still being reviewed. → Correct (addresses the budget's status)

24. Do you like the new carpet in the lobby?
(A) The car is parked outside. → Incorrect (unrelated to the carpet)
(B) No, not at all. → Correct (expresses opinion on the carpet)
(C) Yes, I have several hobbies. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

25. We should go and get some lunch now.
(A) It's a new approach. → Incorrect (unrelated to lunch invitation)
(B) I bought these shoes on sale. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I have a dentist's appointment at noon. → Correct (responds to the lunch suggestion)

26. Would you be interested in a magazine subscription?
(A) Definitely—how much is it? → Correct (shows interest in the subscription)
(B) A full-page ad. → Incorrect (unrelated to subscription interest)
(C) No, it's my own recipe. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

27. I don't think Mr. Beck will like the new production plan.
(A) You don't think so? → Correct (engages with the concern about the plan)
(B) To visit the plant tomorrow. → Incorrect (unrelated to the production plan)
(C) About an hour on Tuesday. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

28. Shouldn't we discuss the advertising campaign now?
(A) On the radio. → Incorrect (refers to medium, not discussion timing)
(B) A roundtable discussion. → Incorrect (describes format, not timing)
(C) No, we have other priorities. → Correct (addresses discussion timing)

29. Where should I put this box of report binders?
(A) The delivery truck is late. → Incorrect (unrelated to binder placement)
(B) Our team report contains a lot of interesting data. → Incorrect (irrelevant to location)
(C) The cabinet in my office is full. → Correct (indicates a problem)

30. Have you seen our orientation video for new employees?
(A) Seven new employees. → Incorrect (unrelated to watching the video)
(B) Yes, I watched it this morning. → Correct (confirms watching the video)
(C) We still haven't met. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

31. When are you planning to take a vacation?
(A) She planned the event herself. → Incorrect (unrelated to vacation timing)
(B) I'm working on three projects. → Correct (refers to work, not vacation)
(C) Could you take our picture, please? → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
